DataElement.preferredName: Total Nodal Irradiation Whole-Abdominal Irradiation Preparative Regimen Planned Administration Total Radiation Therapy Dose
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric value related to the total dose of the nodal or abdominal irradiation for the preparative regimen that was administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Total Nodal Irradiation Whole-Abdominal Irradiation Preparative Regimen Planned Administration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Radiation therapy to the mantle field, the spleen, the lymph nodes in the upper abdomen, and the lymph nodes in the pelvic area._Radiation therapy meant to expose all tissues and organs within the abdominal cavity._The chemotherapy or radiation given prior to blood, marrow, cord blood transplant, or cell infusion to kill diseased cells and make space for the healthy new graft and/or suppress the immune system so rejection does not occur.:To devise, contrive, or form in design._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Total Nodal Irradiation Whole-Abdominal Irradiation Preparative Regimen
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Radiation therapy to the mantle field, the spleen, the lymph nodes in the upper abdomen, and the lymph nodes in the pelvic area.:No Value Exists:The chemotherapy and/or radiation given to bone marrow transplant patients prior to transplant to kill diseased cells and/or make space for healthy new marrow and/or suppress the immune system so graft rejection does not occur.

Concepts.definition: Radiation therapy to the mantle field, the spleen, the lymph nodes in the upper abdomen, and the lymph nodes in the pelvic area.
Radiation therapy meant to expose all tissues and organs within the abdominal cavity.

The chemotherapy or radiation given prior to blood, marrow, cord blood transplant, or cell infusion to kill diseased cells and make space for the healthy new graft and/or suppress the immune system so rejection does not occur.

Property.preferredDefinition: Planned; devised, contrived, or formed in design.:The act of administration.

Concepts.definition: To devise, contrive, or form in design.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.administrativeNotes: 2023.8.7 Updated def for 'No Value Exists'. ak

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Radiation therapy to the entire body. Usually followed by bone marrow or peripheral stem cell transplantation._The cumulative dose amount, in cGy or Rads, administered to each treatment field/site according to protocol.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.:use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.:The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Artificial Neural Network Algorithm for BRIDG Mapping

ReferenceDocuments.name: What was the total prescribed
ReferenceDocuments.description: What was the total prescribed cumulative dose of total nodal or total abdominal irradiation for the preparative regimen (per the protocol)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: BRIDG mapping path for CDE:2685003
ReferenceDocuments.description: PerformedSubstanceAdministration > PlannedActivity > StudyActivity > DefinedSubstanceAdministration.periodProductDoseTotal.PQ.value WHERE DefinedSubstanceAdministration.nameCode = "Administer radiation" AND DefinedProcedure.targetAnatomicSiteCode = "total nodal" OR "total abdominal" AND PerformedSubstanceAdministration > DefinedSubstanceAdministration > DefinedCompositionRelationship > DefinedSubjectActivityGroup.nameCode = "Perform preparative regimen"
